item.title: Setting up the server ip in client.java
item.dc:creator: @wrath0fgufix wrath0fgufix
item.description:
@wrath0fgufix wrote:

Well i’m confused i am making my new server, and the client i’m using had the following: in client java-- if (Server.equals(“127.0.0.1”) || Server.equals(“localhost”)) {
return 1;
} else if (Server.equals("")) {
return 2;

playerServer = inStream.readString();
} catch (Exception e) {
playerServer = “127.0.0.1”;
}

and also: /*if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Jayden”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“127.0.0.1”)){
println(“Not from localhost!”);
returnCode = 9;
disconnected = true;
savefile = false;
return;

And in GUI theres also one: {

System.out.println(“Attempting to Connect”);
Serverip = “exiled-universe.no-ip.biz”;
sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));

it had a different server ip, but i changed it to mine

It says server offline, when i just had it working on a diff source…

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up the server ip in client.java
